If you're voting, use the normal link, but if you're just playing for fun, use the "bug fix" link. It fixes a few bugs with just about everything, and adds more levels and funkier graphics. :)

It's a puzzle platformer, and you'll see how it fits the theme (ish) in the second level :D

Hope you enjoy :)

entries.description:
Instructions provided in-game.
I know it's not great, but it's my first game an I learned a lot :) I really enjoyed making this and although there were some stressful times I kept pushing. I am glad I am finished (Sort-of, the ending never really came to be) and there are some bugs like your head going through some walls but I didn't really have time to fix them.
Hope you enjoy!
oh and F1

entries.description:
Made in Unity3d

Arrow keys control flight
Z shoots weapon
X drops weapon pod.

Land on the carrier to rearm and buy new weapons.

entries.title: Appy 1000mg
entries.description:
I really enjoyed doing this one, even if I got lost completely on the first day, wandering between ideas. Finally, a friend of mine pointed out a detail which unlocked everything. 

I didn't have time to add sounds, so I highly suggest to play an ambient music of yours. I personally recommend the Myst Exile soundtrack.

Thank you Benjamin.


[About the enhanced version]

I fixed many little problems in this version and added an item which was planned to be released in the first version : the dig-cannon. Use this item to dig the walls :) This item is hidden... somewhere.

I also rewrote some parts for better ambient.

Also added some places to discover ingame (using the cannon).

Added an alternative ending.

entries.title: Dragon Island
entries.description:
Hi All,
This is my LD20 submission - I hope you enjoy it!

It's DANGEROUS to go ALONE to DRAGON ISLAND, take this MAGIC LIGHT THING with you, it will protect you!

Use arrows to move, space to attack and Z to unleash magic light upon enemies.

Windows only, I'm afraid.

Made in C++ - using clanlib.
Graphics in GraphicsGale, Paint.NET and Inkscape.
Maps with Tiled map editor.
Music and Sounds with Fruityloops, a few soundfonts and sfxr.

Hope you enjoy this!!

Daniel

Edit: updated the screenshot and title text of the window, nothing else.

entries.title: Elidia
entries.description:
Use your mouse to guide the ship.  Items will appear to help you stay alive.

Try to stay alive as long as possible!

You're going to want your speakers on for this one.  You can use the + or - keys to adjust volume in game.

entries.title: Escape from Hazmat Cave
entries.description:
Run the game by double clicking rungame.bat.  If the game does not run, make sure the game is unziped from the zip file in a folder before running the game rungame.bat


Instructions:  Move the player with WASD keys.  When you pickup a weapon you  can aim/shoot with the mouse/left mouse button.  Follow the path and try to make it to the end.

entries.title: Gemini
entries.description: You control two characters at once. Each character has different abilities. For example the girl, Gem, can jump high and swim in water, but has no weapons and has low health. The robot, ini, can shoot lasers, but gets damaged by water and sucks at jumping. They must work together to get though levels.

entries.title: Hammerspace
entries.description:
Made in Java. You'll need a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) or Java Developer Kit (JDK) to run it.

Known bug: Collision detection isn't always accurate - the player often doesn't get damage.

[EDIT] A fixed version without the collision bug (and some extra firing keys) is available at http://dl.dropbox.com/u/20089037/web/ld20/fixed/

entries.title: Hot Potato
entries.description:
Hot Potato

You control a crack delivery team of couriers.
You've been tasked with a special delivery.
A very important package must be delivered to 
a very important person on the far side of the plaza.

Unfortunately, this very important package seems 
to have gotten some attention from the 
very important person's enemies, and they sent 
agents to try to stop you.

It's a crowded plaza, so try to maneuver around
the pedestrians and avoid the agents.

Get that package to the VIP!

How to play:
-----------

Each turn has four phases:

- Move Couriers
- Shove Couriers
- Move Pedestrians
- Move Agents

The first two phases allow you to control your team of couriers.

Click to select the highlighted courier. Then click on the
highlighted tiles to move or shove.

Agents and the VIP can't be shoved, 
but couriers and pedestrians can be moved one space.

If there are multiple shoveable entities in a line, 
all of them will be shoved one space in the same direction.

If the courier holding the package shoves into a line with any couriers, the 
last courier in the line will be passed the package.

Win by getting the package into a tile adjacent to the VIP.
Lose by letting the package get adjacent to the enemy agents.

entries.title: Inventory of One
entries.description: A compact survival platformer. Try and protect your fragile cargo for as long as possible - can you beat 10 seconds?

entries.title: It's Dangerous to Fall Alone
entries.description:
Developer high score is 1926. Beat that!

Programming: Justin Peavey and Troy Fendall
Music: Reilly Peavey
Art: Reilly Peavey and Paul Maupoux

Credit due to:

entries.title: Jump Climb Die
entries.description:
Use A and D to move left and right (or the left and right keys for you lefties out there)

To jump click the mouse in the direction you would like to jump and the little guy will try to jump towards your cursor.

He has a double jump and a wall slide and with the mouse jumping technique he can turn in mid air instantly.

Within the allotted time I could only implement spikes.. but they seem to make it fun enough to play for a little bit. 

EDIT:
There are 18 levels! And some people are reporting that jumping is not working for them.. Please update to the latest Java jre and this SHOULD fix it.

EDIT2: 
It is pretty hard. I made a quick version that has a skip level button so people could see the other levels if they didn't want to play it. Linked. Press L to skip levels.

Please enjoy!
Cybs

entries.title: KingsExercise
entries.description: In this game you are the son of the king. You want to exercise a bit by running. But your father (The King) thinks it isnt safe for you and give you 9 other people to exercise with. Your goal: Run as much as possible withou losing all your men. The game ends if you lost all your man. You can reset by pressing R. (I saw the competition 2 hours ago and started then. http://goo.gl/d1NIG & http://goo.gl/WDyYc)

entries.title: Lonely Fortress
entries.description:
Mouse + WASD, LMB to jump. Y to toggle mouselook Y-invert.
Some missing content - the tower is shorter then I would have liked with fewer hazards. I'll aim lower next time :)

[EDIT 2] Web link now works, huzzah for Dropbox!
[EDIT 3] Source now provided, so if you want to run it locally you can build from that.

entries.title: Lonely Pods
entries.description:
Lonely Pods is a 2.5D Puzzle Game. You play as an unknown Space Head piloting a SHAB (Space Head All-terrain Vehicle). Your base has been infested by alien creatures, activating the emergency quarantine. Now you must make your way through the locked down base. It's Dangerous To Go Alone! Take... Them!

Can be played with keyboard but for full enjoyment a controller is recommended.

However, the menu can only be navigated via mouse.

The controls for controller are the Analog Stick and Y.

The Kongregate link will be updated as I make changes, so make your ratings based on the Web link. But check the Kong link for the better version.

entries.title: Ludum - the Magic bird of AWESOME
entries.description:
You are a bird, having a machine gun. So you try to shoot your way through five levels, fighting against stationary guns, footman and also helicopters. Fortunatly you can hide behind rocks and walls to dodge their shots, while you try to find the keys for the door to the next level.

My first Ludum Dare entry. Made with HTML5 and Javascript, without any external framework or personal basecode.

entries.title: Quest for the enlightenment
entries.description:
Arrows to move,
z and x when you find the artifact.

I could spend looots of time to polish this baby of mine from the poo, but my stamina is running out and I just have to stare away from the screen for the rest of the day. But dont you worry, i kept this ride very very short for you.

Flashpunk, asesprite for graphics, sounds ... well, musagi and midi synthesizer converted through winamp to wav form which then converted to mp3 by audacity.

Well, it's all a decent basecode for a zeldaclone. Not going for competition becouse I dont like to show how ugly some of the solutions are, although you could of course just decompile the flash and look at it.. But also I, for simplicity's sake, copied parts of my previously made delayed text displayer (which is also not pretty). Next year maybe i'll have enough energy to make a proper proper competition entry.

entries.title: Robots nicked my stuff!
entries.description:
Here's my entry! I made an arcade shooter in 33 hours:) Hope people will like it:D

entries.description:
Needs python and pygame, source linked.

Think you've done well! When you lose, press s to submit your highscore!

entries.title: Super Fat Man
entries.description: My Ludum Dare 20 entry. Save the world from impending doom! Eat the candy to save everyone! Eat fruit to get skinnier to fit in tight places! . This isn't as good as it was going to be because of real life.

entries.title: The Village Elder
entries.description:
In this game you are a village elder of a small village. Help the village grow by advising the villagers what to do (gather food, build houses or procreate). 

Each turn your villagers will have to eat, and will pay you a gold tribute if they are happy with the way they live. Every turn will also spawn a random event with multiple choices based on prerequisites.

The goal of the game is to acquire unique items from the random events (only 4 implemented at release), and then invite questing characters into your village and give them the item they seek/need.

Four points brings you to the partyscreen. If all villagers are gone, the game is over. Made with unity3d, played with the mouse. Unfortunately I didn't have time for sound or music =(

PS: The web version might not display the GUI properly if a browser's zoom level is not at 100%. Resetting it to 100% should bring up all buttons and such.

entries.title: Total Achluophobia
entries.description:
My game competition called Total Achluophobia.

Target platform: Windows
The game requires at least Microsoft XNA Framework 3.1 to work.
To get it, follow this link: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=53867a2a-e249-4560-8011-98eb3e799ef2

Can be played directly from the extracted .zip, no install required.

The game is only a demo, I didn't have enough time to finish the game story, it playable though.

entries.title: Zombieland
entries.description:
I am the sole creator of this top-down shooter, and its my first completed game!

You've been thrown into a world filled to the brim with zombies. Make it to the exit to survive while avoiding zombies eating your brain! Killing zombies and destroying their spawn points earns points. Run over cell phones to read their last text message for some story. 

There are small bugs aplenty, but the game is playable.
I've included a OS/X build, but I have no idea if it functions correctly.

entries.title: ... Take This Triangle!!!
entries.description:
Take This Triangle is an abstract defense / shooter. Protect the pentagon from swarms of incoming triangles.

Click+Drag to launch triangles, don't squander your limited ammo!

How many waves can you survive? (My record is ~26)

This Ludum Dare I decided:
1) I wanted to make something actually *fun* to play, f*ck content and story telling.
2) Pixel art is overrated. It is all about the vectors!

Written using SDL + SDL_ttf + SDL_mixer. If you are interested in porting this to linux please do! I would love it. (Took <5mins to port it to windows when I finally got tools set up.)

If you have any trouble running this send me an email!

Note: Updated OS/X link to include frameworks. Should work now without having to install SDL/SDL_mixer/SDL_ttf or anything at all.

entries.title: Another Rainy Day
entries.description:
I have completed a game with absolutely no coding capability, only a vague idea of what I wanted and in only 48 hours. God I did well.
Controls:
right to go right, left to go left, up to activate invisible jet pack and click for information on something.

entries.title: Cheese Hunter
entries.description:
First timer!

Since the theme is a quote from Zelda 1, I figured, like some other participants, that the right thing to do was to attempt a Zelda clone.

Our character is on a quest for cheese, on behalf of his princess wife thingie. One gameplay element I figured out was interesting - was the shapeshifting item.  A paperclip is an item you can modify - and you toggle its shape with a.  The only usable shape in this game, however - is the fireball-throwing wand (you shoot with f).

This game has quite a few bugs - but it's perfectly possible to finish - it could however use some more content in the dungeon.  But this is what I feel I had the time and capacity to do - my main excuse is that I've been fighting with my own basecode.  I'll definitely be better prepared for LD21.

The game was developed on Linux, and is cross-compiled for Windows.

entries.title: Condom Corps
entries.description:
*** If you are judging, please play the COMPO version.

*** If you are NOT judging, play the JAM version in its (legally) photosourced splendor.

BUGS:
- You randomly get "2500" points sometimes, and then it spawns additional NPCs everywhere... I'm not sure why it happens and can't reproduce it. If you can figure it out, I'd be much obliged.


>>> BASICALLY
It's a Match3 First Person Sniper for sex education.

>>> HOW TO PLAY
Mouse1 = fire
Mouse2 = zoom in
Mousewheel = change ammotype

1) Stare at a dude's package. Decide what size of condom he needs.
2) Shoot the condom into his hand.
3) Match adjacent colors to create chain-climaxes for mega points.
4) Shoot well-fitting condoms to maintain a "fit streak" multiplier for your score.


>>> SOURCE CODE
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/19887116/CondomCorps/condomcorps_srccode.unitypackage

entries.title: Danger at US Robotics
entries.description:
A 2D platformer built in pygame.  Mainly inspired by Megaman X.

The robots at US Robotics have all gone insane and started destroying everything!  Except you, a self intelligent robot named Robbie.  Find and rescue the scientists.

Now the windows link comes with a win32 exe.  The source link is smaller and requires python 2.5-2.7 and pygame 1.9. 


Controls:

arrow keys/wasd.  More explained in game.  Listen to those wordy engineers.


Good playing!

entries.title: Finely Tuned Corridormabob
entries.description:
The corridormabob is out and about.. running wherever he might find dangers to avoid.
A and D to slow down and speed up, Other instructions found in-game.

this game requires XNA 4.0 which is linked at the top, please install before playing. (No restart required, Yay!)

entries.title: Fishing vs Aliens
entries.description:
Fishing/Alien shooting game.

Controls:
X - switches modes. you can't switch mode while reeling a fish.
left/right - move in fishing mode, aim in firing mode.
up/down - raise/lower line in fishing mode.
space - hooks and reels in fish in fishing mode, shoots in firing mode. Also skips the intro, but the intro is the best part of the game!

Sadly my sleeping pattern messed things up a lot and so this is largely unfinished. :/ There's not much gameplay, no audio, and the code is somehow worse than anything I've ever done before. All things considered though, I'm pretty happy with what I've done - especially as far as presentation goes, which is usually my weak point - and I've got (and been given) a variety of ideas for turning it into what could be a pretty enjoyable game, so I may be developing this further for the Jam or later.

entries.title: Forge Story - a story about friendship
entries.description: This is a facebook game. Players can paint an object and they can sell the object to other people. They can also share the object to their facebook wall so their friends can get it for free.

entries.title: Furious Fighting Felines
entries.description:
Instructions are on the web page.

Furious Fighting Felines is a mish mash of Zelda 2, the meme theme and beat 'em up style gameplay.

There are three levels to go through, the game ends when you defeat the boss.

I'm pretty content with the result of this LD. The product is far from polished but I can see myself having a lot of fun starting up a beat 'em up after this. So any criticism or suggestions are very much appreciated!

Built in Flash CS4 with Flash Builder (code and graphics).
Sound - sfxr and Otomata (http://www.earslap.com/projectslab/otomata)

Libs
TweenerMax
Senocular Keypoller
gSkinner's Rndm

links.label: Stand Alone (In case of load problems)

entries.title: Incomplete Rope-Based Game
entries.description:
Clever title, eh? As entries go this one was a bit of a fail, too much time on tech and getting used to chipmunk, not enough time, y'know, making a game. Also came into the compo sleepdep'd and stayed that way throughout, so by midnight saturday I was beyond useless. Can't win or lose, no objectives, no menu, but it's got a rope!

Fairly pleased with the rope dynamics, and while there is no game here, I did have fun playing around with them.

Controls:
arrows move left/right, up jumps; ctrl anchors or releases the rope. 

Was going to have rope extensions as pick-ups, but didn't get to it, so hacked in keys; you can hit '1' to switch to the looong rope (1000px) and 2 to switch back to the short one (200px).

entries.title: It's dangerous to "go" alone! Take this.
entries.description:
*If you are voting, please click the "Web" link for the competition version!*

*If you are not voting, try the "Jam" link.*

This is an old school arcade puzzler. You play as a guy who needs to "go" to the bathroom, and will take a kitten with him so he's not alone... and it is dangerous.  The game is HTML5/JavaScript using the Akihabara engine, and the graphics are a bit of a ZX Spectrum flavor.

entries.title: Kokoriki for Ludum Dare
entries.description:
Kokoriki for Ludum Dare. You are alone, and your mission is to kill the killer giant bees on the forest. But it's dangerous to go alone, so search first for the fireflies and use them against the bees. Use ten of them to kill a bee. Drag the mouse around the screen to move the hero (left button pressed). Press space to start or re-start. Follow the arrows to locate the nearest firefly or to know where the bees are.

This it's a Java game, to run it you must double click it or use command line 'java -jar kokorikiLudumDare.jar' (or in Linux, set the executable bit and open with JRE). Tested on OSX, Windows and Linux. It it does't start, try updating your Java version.

Software used:
- Libgdx as the Game Framework (thanks Mario)
- Eclipse as IDE
- Inkscape and Gimp for graphics
- Audacity and cfxr for sounds

Note: This is my very first game, just made to try out Libgdx and myself. There is a lot of non-implemented things in my checklist (no time enough, I'm learning), but ... hey, it's my first game!!!

entries.title: Nano Seed
entries.description:
Explore the nano and risk great danger with your trusty nano seed.

I'm happy with what I've made here, though I was only able to work on it Saturday. It represents about 8 hours of work.

entries.title: Overcoming danger with trees
entries.description: My first LD game. Far from perfect, but it's playable.

entries.title: Phantom Keeper
entries.description:
(Strange name, yes.)

This is a game in which you must form a party of soul creature things to help you fight other soul creature things. What plot there is you can find within the game.


To control yourself:
Arrow keys for movement
Z for going "back" in menus, for opening the menu when not in battle, and accelerating the dialogue (when held)
X for swinging the net, for confirming menu options, and progressing dialogue

To read signs/notes and to pick up items just walk over them. To encounter an enemy, stand still in a cloud and press x to swing the net.

A few gameplay notes: using a shard regenerates a soul, and defeating an enemy with a rune will capture it.


There is no sound nor music, feel free to vote 1 in that category, or N/A if you're too nice for that.

As you very quickly learn in the game, it is not nearly finished. The stats are unbalanced, the world consists of a single cave, and the number of creatures is six. I wanted to continue into the Jam to pump a little more content into it, but I had school.

I probably won't be working on the game soon, though, because I've got something a lot more exciting (to me, at least) in the works.

entries.title: Space Danger
entries.description:
Shoot'em up.

Requires OpenAL.

Does not work if the path contains accents (and possibly other special characters).

There's also a terrible memory leak somewhere, I recommend at least 2GB Ram and restarting after each round. I will investigate this, but not today.

entries.title: Spider Babies
entries.description: Getting a cold prevented a good day of work, so no graphics. Just core mechanics and debug box2d graphics. Enjoy!

entries.title: TAKE THIS!!!
entries.description:
The official info page for game is HERE:
http://phantomgreen.com/take-this/

You can read about the game, view the controls, and also download the .zip file. The game is also directly linked from the WINDOWS link above.

I didn't really finish my game... and it isn't even really a game since there's no way to lose or win, but I had a blast as usual! 

SO YEAH. It's a 2D beat 'em up and you... uh... beat up everyone.

How it fits the theme? Just play it and you'll see.

:D

entries.title: The Adventures of Adam We
entries.description:
An RPG style game requiring you to defeat the enemies on the map. Don't judge a book by it's cover though, there are friendly NPC's hidden in the fray.

Game is incomplete, but such is life when you only have 48 hours :)

Tools Used:
    Python 2.7
    Pygame 1.9.2.pre-release
    PyPubSub-3.1.1b1
    Eclipse 3.5.2
    PyDev 2.0
    Py2exe

entries.title: The Creek
entries.description:
Intro

Navigate your way through the creeks in an inflatable tube using your trusty paddle. Avoid the crocs and ride the currents to safety. 

Instructions

* try and make it safely through each of the three creeks 
* alter direction by paddling (clicking) 
* further away you click from tube the stronger the stroke 
* avoid the crocs 

About

My first Ludum Dare effort, and my first Haxe project, next time I'll be better prepared!

entries.title: The Dark
entries.description:
to use the Mac and Linux versions, you will need to install the love2d engine, found here: http://love2d.org

The game was going to include a lot more RPG elements, but I ran out of time, so I scaled it back to a dungeon runner.

hope everyone enjoys

entries.title: Unknown Planet
entries.description:
Survival shooter on unknown planet with alien monsters and quest element.

Tools used:
-Unity
-3ds max
-Photoshop
-Bfxr
-Audacity
-Free voice synth online

entries.title: Bad Hotel
entries.description:
A 3 button realtime strategy tower defense brick dropping game. Press Z X C to attach shields to the hotel... make sure that no missiles it it. Shield building takes a while to recharge.

Added a jam version with better music, sound efx and mochi high score list.

entries.title: Clone Wolf
entries.description:
CONTROLS:
    LEFT / RIGHT - walk
    SPACE - jump
    X - clone
    Z - attack 

According to the LD20 theme, "It's dangerous to go alone!", therefore our hero gets a special magic item from a village elder.
Upon using the item, the copy of the hero appears. The funny part is, that the magic item itself is copied, as well.
This way you can make your copies in an exponential manner.

The maximum limit of hero copies is 64, there are 9 levels (procedurally generated).

Enjoy!

Tools used:
 - code: Actionsscript 3 code - vi, Flex 3 mxmlc
 - audio: sfxr + autotrack-c
 - graphics: Gimp
Libraries:
 - Flixel v2.3

entries.title: Codename: Taken
entries.description:
Just survive the time you can (no actions taken if you die... and you are very strong for now). 

Green Robot protects you from Red robots, move your character with LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys and jump with the UP arrow key.

Missing features:

* Points based on survival time
* Die and Game Over
* Health bars
* more...

Theme relation:

You can't defend by yourself from the red robots so it is dangerous to go alone but you have your friendly green robot (a gift from the game creator) which is really happy to defend you from the other robots. However, your robot moves slower than you so you have to wait for him otherwise you will be alone and ... that is dangerous.

Hope you could play it.

UPDATE: 

Jam version contains more stuff like Game Over and a Scores. 

I have modified the links to point the Web link to our blog where all links are listed (source code, time lapse, gameplay, etc).

entries.title: Courier of the Crypts
entries.description:
Young courier gets a letter from an old man who wants it delived to the keeper of the Crypts saying "It's dangerous to go alone! Take this!" and he gives magic torch to the courier.
Help him deliver the letter!

KEYS: 
- Cursor keys

TIPS: 
- If your flame bar reaches zero, you'll get eaten
- Pick magic coal on the ground to rise your flame

REQUIREMENTS:
- Windows XP/Vista/7

First two levels are nothing more than walking to get used to the game (they were meant for a tutorial). Next levels are spiced up with enemies.

entries.title: Fight This!
entries.description: An adventure game turning out to be something else.

entries.title: Going Alone
entries.description:
Didn't get to work on it as much as I'd like to due to having to work on Sunday. But it is in a playable state so I'm submitting it anyway. Plan on finishing it more later.

entries.title: Hagerbot
entries.description:
Controls are A W D. Enjoy! The basic premise was a robot being infused with the power of every color robot before leaving on a perilous journey. I didn't have time to fit in the story, but the game mechanics are there!

*Hint* If you think that last level is impossible, slide off a platform and jump while falling. Or just watch this:

http://vimeo.com/23184283

Windows: This should run fine out of the box as long as you have java installed.

OSX: For some reason the .app doesn't want to work for me after being downloaded. If it is broken, feel free to download the Linux version which contains the raw .jar file.

Linux: You should be able to type java -jar Hagerbot.jar in order to run it.

entries.title: I Don't Need Your Stupid Weapons
entries.description: It's not really that dangerous.  Honestly

entries.title: Innocence
entries.description:
"Innocence" is a shoot-'em-up with online highscores. 
There's only three levels... I thought I'd have time to make more, but making the art was troublesome.

Move with arrow keys.
Shoot with Z or Space keys.

Obs: there's no preloader, so it might take some time to show the title screen. :P

entries.title: It's Dangerous: The Escort Quest
entries.description:
To play, unzip the folder and launch the web page "play_game.html".

I had a lot of fun - this being my first Ludum Dare, I definitely didn't have time for everything I thought I would (like a background).  Still, I'm happy with what I managed to complete.  Enjoy!

entries.title: It's Time
entries.description:
God, I wish I had more time...
This is not finished: I planned to do multiple levels and stuff, but programming the level editor took way too long. I didn't even have time to test the level :/
Anyway, here is my half finished entry.

Move with the arrow keys, change gun with tab (if you have one in your stash) and fire the gun with space.

With Linux and OSX, you need to download the LOVE (http://www.love2d.org/) framework to run the game. Once installed, you should be able to run the game by double clicking `itstime.love' or running `/path/to/love /path/to/itstime.love' in your shell.
The windows version is a packaged version of the engine and the game.

entries.title: Multiplayer Zombie Garden Adventure
entries.description:
Aaarrghrghrghrgr! That was a nightmare.

It's a game about stealing jewels from a garden maze full of zombies.

all instructions can be found on the game's index page. 

**Please contact me if you get a message about the server being down!!!**

This is a game designed for multiple players on 2 teams - It should run in any web browser that supports the HTML5 canvas element.... HOWEVER *USE CHROME* for best results as the networking will be smoother than any other browser.

I don't quite know where to begin describing the process of developing this game. Suffice to say I did something more complicated (by the networking) than I should have. The shooring mechanics are buggy and the graphics are barely more than placeholders but it was a rush at end to get some actual game mechanics in.

On the birght side, as an excercise in writing a multiplayer tcp server and client this was more successfull than I expected. Especially when leveraging web sockets in chrome. The speed is awesome considering it's HTML and people are used to this tech having a latency of a couple of seconds, nevermind 16ms!!.

If you're looking for the theme, it's the idea that you should take some team-mates into the middle of the maze with you, since you can't fight off the zombies on your own when carrying a jewel.

entries.title: Myrktorch
entries.description:
Myrktorch!

Slay the undead with holy light!

Beware of Ghosts!


Post-Compo-Jam Update:
-Added a way to acquire life.
-Improved graphics, added lots of sounds and various tweaks.


/If you plan on judging the game, remember to play the compo entry!

entries.title: Party Favours
entries.description: What's more dangerous than being alone at a boring party? Escape it with some...substances. Maintain sanity while things get weird.

entries.title: RELIEF!!
entries.description:
My first ludum dare and it was an ordeal, but a blast! 
In this game, you pilot a lady who cannot venture to a public restroom alone!  Arrow keys move and the 'any' key does all the rest.  

I used an unregistered version of Game Maker for this because I'm just not good with this stuff so if there's anything i need to edit for people to be able to play, just let me know.  

If level 8 is too hard you can hit the delete key instead of the any key on game start to begin at the last level which is much easier and goofier.

entries.title: Soul Keeper [ fixed link ]
entries.description:
Finally we managed to upload a working version! to keep our loyalty to the "72 hours" rule of the jam, we're uploading the version that contains only what we managed to accomplish in those 72 hours. Even tough we wish to upload a new version with extra levels untill the weekend, it will be done in a sepparate link. Please check out and comment :]


Well, it's not as ellaborate as we wished it was, but here's the first version of our game . Since it's dangerous to go alone,take this pendant, now you're never alone. We'll be adding levels along the week . 

Controls :  

Arrow Keys - Move around/jump

Space Bar  - Action 

NOTE : THIS VERSION ONLY HAS THE TUTORIAL LEVEL TO SHOW GAMEPLAY! we will be uploading new levels as soon as possible.

entries.title: Sprung
entries.description:
Sprung is a first person platformer that ignores those pesky laws of physics that make the world such a drab and boring place.  While universal law breaking may sound like a fun activity the dangers here are very real. Take on three levels of spring filled madness in Sprung. 

Forward -> W
Back -> S
Left -> A
Right ->D
Jump -> Space
Rotate/Look -> Mouse

While holding down one of the move keys you accelerate.
The faster you move the higher you jump.
Build momentum in order to get over pits.

This game uses WebGL so you need a browser that can support it.  It was developed in Chrome and a couple of modifications were made to port it to Firefox.

entries.title: Take It Take It Take This
entries.description:
Wise Man's Wisdom Emporium and Item Dispensary: Take It Take It Take This!
One man's journey to give everyone what they want, or at the very least, something they wouldn't mind.

Game is pretty simple. Press space to spawn an adventurer (much like the title character of the theme's game) who will tell you their plight (or tell you something, in most cases) and you are free/forced with your infinite wisdom to give them an item from your cave. There are several "good" options and occasionally some special "bad" options. Experiment!

Also, you'll notice from the screenshots that there is a hidden space shooter game. Try to find it!

I used FlashPunk as the engine, did the sounds with SFXR and the background music on my keyboard. All of these were new things for me, so horray for finishing.

entries.title: Ted, the singleminded adventurer
entries.description:
Windows users (tested on XP and Vista*):
- Run run.bat to start the game

Linux/Mac OSX users:
- make sure you have python and pyglet installed
- run 'python main.py' to start the game

Ted walks by himself, but occasionally needs a helping hand. After all, its far too dangerous for him to go alone. You have to supply him the items he needs to stay safe for zombies and crushers. Zombies can be disabled by a sword, while crusher mechanisms can be disabled using a stick.

Drop the necessary items on the floor for Ted to pick up by clicking the left mouse button. You can scroll between the two available items using your scroll wheel. Note that in the first levels, both items are disabled (indicated by the black outline of the item). When the items are in short supply, a number is presented over the item, indicating the number of remaining items you can drop on the screen.

When dead, press the left mouse key once to restart the level. To quit the game, hit escape.

* I have received some reports about Pyglet crashing on some Windows machines, so your milage may vary.

entries.title: The ADD RPG
entries.description:
Just one thing:

I apologize for what you are about to play.

Controls:
Sometimes mouse, somtimes cursor + spacebar (Sorry!)

Every time you complete an event, you go back in time. Its not that the game restarted, it continues :)

entries.title: The Extinct Fireplace

A little 2D game.

Requires at least .NET Framework 3.5.

Used libraries: SFML 1.6 and Farseer Physics engine.

Coded in C#.

Spoiler: If I had time and I didn't get stuck on dumb bug the gameplay would be more complete.

entries.title: The Last Survivor
entries.description: You are the last survivor. Solve the puzzles and platforming challenges to be able to discover your true form!

entries.title: Woplin
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move, space to advance text.

A stealth/puzzle game, you must take your targets by separating one from the crowd (using a system of traps and level elements) before approaching.

(You can toggle the music on/off by clicking the icon or pressing M, but I forgot to make sure that object would stick around after the first level.)

entries.title: >Start >Fight >Run
entries.description:
A not very serious visual novel. (Apologies for the sketches, I didn't have time to tidy and colour them, but wanted to get them in the game. And there's no music, sorry.)

Edit: Fixed a couple of bugs that were hiding some content, though not much. Eep. (Literally a 2 minute fix just after I woke up, yawn!)

From the readme:

SPACE: advance text
ENTER: confirm/advance text
Hold CTRL: Skip previously read text
ARROW KEYS: pick option
ESCAPE: quit
F: toggle fullscreen (off by default)

(Or use the mouse for all things!)


Apologies if there are bugs. I only played the game through a couple of times to check that it can be won and lost. :)

entries.title: A Unnamed Whale Adventure
entries.description: I really failed at time management this time.. it's an complicated game about whale riddles

entries.title: Boomerang !
entries.description:
Boomerang is a 2d sidescroller/platformer. Also it is my first Ludum Dare entry.
Made of:
C/C++
SDL, SDL_image, SDL_ttf, SDL_mixer
sfxr
gimp

entries.title: Brik-A-Brak Item Shop
entries.description:
I was away this entire weekend, so I've only had a little time to code today (lunch and the train ride here) to work on it.  Anyway!  I wanted to do something like Scribblenauts and a text adventure game... so here you have the Brik-A-Brak Item Shop where you must provide an item to the adventurer who needs your help.  Currently I only have 20 different endings/responses for roughly 80 different words.

How many endings can you see?

If you would like to see MORE endings for certain words, let me know!  It's quick to add and I've love to make this as robust and ridiculous as possible.

I wish I knew more about databases and how to query/store information via AS3.  That way I could make a much better system of determining items and endings than the giant SWITCH/CASE statement I have.  :T

entries.title: CatTroller
entries.description:
In CatTroller your mission is to get to Ludum Dare #20. You will start off the game by seeing a cat and the cat will give you the CatTroller. Then you begin your quest to fight the Rat Menace who is trying to stop you from finishing your project. Defeat him and you will have finished your LD on time and in a great fashion!

Movement - Arrows
Jump - Z
Attack - X

Timelapse is up!

entries.title: Cave: The Dark Ascent
entries.description:
After a lot of work and staying awake for over 30 hours straight, I have a working game!

Brief overview:
You are someone who got lost and somehow managed to fall into a cave. There are other people down there who will reward you for defeating the monsters around them. You can use the items that you receive from the old men in your battles against more monsters.

The items you can get are as follows (weakest to strongest):
Rope
Kitten
Dagger
Sword
Vial of Acid
and...Justin Beiber. His voice can make even the most deadly of monsters want to commit suicide!

Hope you all enjoy my entry. I will add audio post-compo since I REALLY need to sleep and my brain is a bit fried right now.

entries.title: Change of Heart
entries.description:
Change of Heart is a combination of survival horror and dark science fiction thriller. If you are familiar with the works of Scott Sigler (such as Infected) or perhaps World War Z, then you have an idea of what I was aiming for here.

Please note, there is a ton of strong language, gore and violence in the narrative. The is commensurate with other fiction in the genre, but I do throw the f-bomb around quite a bit (just because I can).

It is an audio only game. Basically it is a combination of an audio book and a 'choose your own adventure' book.

I managed to shrink the swf to 7 megs and it is on Kongregate now. Thank god. Still seems to sound pretty good in 32 mono.

You will listen to the story and occasionally be prompted to make decision that affect how the game progresses. There are multiple endings (even a happy one in there somewhere).

When you need to make a decision, press either 1 or 2.

The game is written in flash 10 with flash punk.

Please play this when you are relaxed and feeling like reading a book. It progresses slowly and will not give you the instant thrills of most games.

entries.title: Danger Lawn
entries.description:
All Jimmy wanted to do was play, but it was too dangerous to go alone. So take the super hammer and smash your way through this fun outdoor experience!

Team:
-Cooshinator: Artist, Musician, Designer, Co-Programmer
-Dsv101: Lead Programmer 

This game was Cooshinator's third LD entry and second flash game, & was Dsv101's second LD entry and his second flash game.

Tools:
-Compiler: Flex SDK
-IDE: FlashDevelop & Ubuntu Text Editor
-Library: FlashPunk
-Sound Effects: Sfxr
-Spriting: Gimp 2.6
-Music: LSDJ
-Level Editing: Ogmo Editor

entries.title: Don't Go Alone
entries.description:
EEEEKK!! I didn't quite finish!  And I'm out of time! Well... Here it is nonetheless!  My first ever LD entry:  

Don't Go Alone.

The idea is that you're playing a horizontal shooter, and your power ups (which were 80% implemented at time of submission and are therefore, sadly, disabled) are people you meet along the way, who follow behind you and fight along-side you.

I didn't get the Boss working correct either :( - It's a Dodongo.  They dislike smoke.

Coded in Python and Pygames.  I've never coded in Python before, so that adds to the amazingness of this entry for sure.

Art:  MS Paint and occasional Gimp
Music:  CodeMonkey's little script thing
Sfx: Bfxr

ENJOY!~<3

entries.title: Fearless journalist version 0.9
entries.description:
It's still missing a bit of hud information, like the score. Still, it's playable and I don't know if I'll have the chance to resubmit before the end of the Jam.

This game was made in 24 hours (of literally nonstop work) by me and my friend Luc. I programmed it and he made the art.

this was programmed in C++ from scratch, using SDL

For the next versions:
-more random patterns of enemies
-scores
-progress bar
-better detection of the flashlight/camera
-better algorithm for rotation than the SDL_gfx rotozoom
-best picture taken is saved on your hard drive
-music and sound effects

PS: I didn't massage it much to make it easier to run. Maybe later if I bother finishing it.

entries.title: It's dangerous to go alone, take these shiny things!
entries.description:
Executable is in "Dist", and is called "LD20".

To play the game, simply move around (arrow keys) collect the diamond shaped shiny things, take these around the level until you need to use one to disable a wall section if matching colour (space bar). You can only use them in reverse order to what you collected them, so most recently collected first - be wise what order you take them. You must get to the purple spiny thing to advance to the next level.

First entry using my own engine, Psybrus. All engine code used is based on what was located at https://github.com/neilogd/Psybrus at the start of LD.

All game code is written in GameMonkey (http://www.somedude.net/gamemonkey/). See the .gm files in "Dist/Source" for all the game code, it's the first time I've actually written much using GM, so I've tried a few different ways of doing things - it's pretty damned messy code :)

OSX (v1) is the original submission, only an OSX build included.
OSX & Windows (v2) is the same as the original, but includes a Windows build, and I've optimised the rendering of the map due to incredibly low performance inside of my Windows install, there are no other changes.

A word on compatibility: It requires SM3 (OpenGL 2.0+).

entries.title: Light The Way
entries.description:
Mouse - Aim light
WASD or D pad - Move
Left mouse button - Make them jump
Alt+Enter - Toggle full screen (recommended)

I had to work at my real job for most of the weekend so this represents only about 10 hours of work at the most. That makes this the single fastest game I've ever developed.  I used my own game engine with Box2D and Visual Studio Express.  There is no message when you reach the end but it should be obvious.

After you finish if you want to see some behind the scenes stuff about how my engine works press F4 to toggle edit mode.  Or press ~ to bring up the debug console then use tab and up/down to cycle through the debug command list.

I put up a post comp enhanced version and a link to my website with a video.

If you see a missing DLL message then you must update Microsoft DirectX.  I build with a very old version of DirectX libs to try to prevent against that.

entries.title: mainFrank
entries.description:
WASD+Mouse (Ctrl, Space - jump alternatives).

mainFrank(){

A simple action-platformer focused on controlling a robot, jumping a whole lot, and hitting mechanical crabs with a rotten fish repeatedly until they blow up. And killer clams, too. All that to recover Frank's slippers, even though he doesn't have feet.

Made in Game Maker 8 Pro, some photoshop and SFXR. I had a blast making it, and I hope you enjoy playing it, even though it's rather short. 

I'd really appreciate some bug reports and general feedback. Heck, if you want to, just tell me and I'll update it after the competition with more levels. (:

entries.title: POLARITY
entries.description:
Play the game by clicking on the magnetic plates.  Left click repels, and right click attracts.  Get to the exit without falling to your doom.

Originally you would earn the laser (take this), but it had to be cut for time.

entries.title: Super Shotgun Deathrace
entries.description:
In a dystopian future ruled by zombies, you'll have to rely on your superior human reflexes to survive. Press X or Space to jump, use the arrow keys to move. Good luck, and don't get bitten.

Uses Flixel 2.5 and Flixel Power Tools. Music made with Garage Band for iPad. Sounds generated using sfxr and my lungs. Edited in Audacity.

Also, I'll be posting a timelapse of the whole 48 hours (minus sleepingtimes) - stay tuned for that.

entries.title: Talisman
entries.description:
Made with Flixel, Flixel Power Tools, Reason, sfxr, Flash Develop, Tilestudio.

Object: Pass the Talisman on to as many other survivors as possible. Avoid monsters.

Synopsis:

"We'd been stuck in the cave for so long. Dad's health had failed. The sickness had slowly killed him, and I'd started to feel it myself. I had to see if there was anyone else out there. I needed help. As I left the cave that had become our home, I gripped the Talisman and his last words echoed in my ears: 'It's dangerous to go alone. Take this!'"

entries.title: TelePortal
entries.description:
Something like a Mixture by Pokemon & Portal.
Have fun!

entries.title: Thank You Hobo
entries.description:
You wander unarmed into a zombie infested graveyard, but lucky for you there's a strangely well stocked hobo that let's you use his weapons. He is also very undecisive, as you will learn right away.

WASD or arrows to move.
Mouse to aim and shoot.

entries.title: the Child
entries.description:
Just a routine graveyard shift at the old research hospital, until something goes horribly, horribly awry.

Directional keys to move, mouse clicks to interact.
Running is possible, but uncomfortable.

Do it for the children.

Edit : the 'Web' build may load slowly due to server overload. In the event of such an unfortunate occurrence, please use the Kong link, as the build is identical there.

Edit 2 : Cleaned up the links a bit, the Windows/OSX/Source links are all available from the Web link page, under the 'Download Links' section.  Replaced with Walkthrough, Timelapse, and Twitter links.

entries.title: Tim: Legends
entries.description:
Hi, I worked pretty hard on this. I think it's worth playing.

Controls are explained in-game, except "r" restarts a level.

I have a time lapse, but I haven't made it into a video yet. That's coming soon.

entries.title: Trollbridge Armours

Become a shopkeeper, craft weapons and sell them to the heroes. It's all HTML and javascript, bring a svg able browser.

The result is not very complete. You can craft, sell and buy but the tech tree just didn't want to work. Also the only browser to really use it is Safari/Webkit as I forgot to test with Firefox which has this odd behaviour with offsetTop and such...

entries.title: Armageddon Moochery
entries.description:
It's the end of the world for most, a lucrative opportunity for you!

Talk to townsfolk and try to convince them to give you stuff, because you're "such a hero" and you're going to go "save the world."

---
This was my first LD competition, and I'm pretty happy with what I ended up with. Using some foundational library is always a good idea, and flixel came in handy for getting the small stuff out of the way quickly. I didn't have too much struggle with finding an idea, which I was stoked about.

I need to blog more next time.

i saw the post of this gamemania very late so i only worked 5 hours on it - Hope you all Enjoy!

Use the arrow keys. Kill all the enemies to continue to the next room.

One of my less complete LD games, but I think it shows some promise?

entries.title: It's dangerous to go alone! (Jam entry)

You'll be herdin' some sheep through dark valley while bad wolves are devouring all the poor sheep who are separated from the pack.

You need to beat the sheep to get back to the pack and use fury power up in tough spots.

Survive your way trough the valley and you'll be successful!

Boochita Choursri - Characters

entries.title: Let Me Save You! Your Faithful Companion
entries.description:
You're given plenty of things in this game, including Cornelia. But whether she stays with you depends on what you do...

Unzip the file, then start "ld20.exe" to play :)

Source code: included in the folder as script.py
Tools: Sibelius First, Audacity, Synthfont, Paint Tool SAI, Photoshop CS, Ren 'Py.
Size/Scope: 12 MB download, play time 5-10mins (unless you like staring at semi-naked anime babes, in which case, longer XD)

My first Ludum Dare. As I only started learning Ren 'Py 5 days prior to the competition, apologies if things aren't perfect.

Bug/errors reported:
Lady Gigi saying "receipt" rather than "recipe" - coincidentally, not such a bad typo, as receipt is an old English word for recipe! XD
Older ATI graphics drivers crash - http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/05/04/older-ati-drivers-and-renpy/
ADDED LINK in case of Windows Computers with old ATI drivers (bug in Ren'Py 6.12.0e, not my fault! Same game but in Ren'Py 6.12.15, read the post for more info)

entries.title: Old Man Village
entries.description:
You are in Old Man Village. Can you WIN the game?

Installation:
You need to install the ttf font. (Place in windows/fonts or wherever it needs to be on your OS)
On Linux, libclutter needs to be installed.

Few notes:
You can exit town on the right and the left edges of town.
There are two ways to lose the game.
The game is hard coded to run at a windowed resolution of 1280x720. 

Good luck!

entries.title: Overdead

Overdead is an zombie action RPG game. 

The game was developed in less than 12 hours

The game was made in RPG Maker XP [ no coding, saving time]

[The game will take you no longer than 30minutes to complete]

[You may have to install the RTP, but it's included in the RAR file]

Source is included in the realase

entries.title: PandaBot
entries.description:
A&D to Move
W&S to Open & Close
Spacebar to Jump
E&R for fun (not implemented)

L&R Arrows to move
U&D Arrows to open & close

entries.title: Postman Chicky!
entries.description:
Chicky got a new job! He wants to be a postman! So help him make all the sad mailboxes happy again! The task of a postman is no easy one! So take these....BOOTS with you!

Use LEFT/RIGHT and SPACE to control Chicky. Starting from level 3 he'll also be able to kick!


Author's notes:
Wow. Flash. Flixel. But I'm not too happy about this submission. It's the first time I worked with Flixel, (just reading the tutorial on friday), and personally, I'm not totally convinced with Flixel. I'm sure I could have done a lot more. I used to work with gosu before. Too many animations make flash slow o.O.
Also, in the beginning, after hearing the theme, I wanted to add a LOT more items :< (if you take a look at the source, you'll see some). Bubblegum! A Super Soaker! And the construction manual for an IKEA Billy shelf! (all scrapped)
Oh yeah, and I had a lot of problems with the graphics. In the end, I made all with Paint++ instead of PhotoShop :O
I included 9 levels. Have fun!

entries.title: Solo Adventurers' Hospital
entries.description:
"It was dangerous to go alone! Here, take this potion."

You are a nurse in a hospital for Adventurers who went out into the dangerous wilds alone, and got poisoned. Now they're sick, and you have to cure them!

To cure a YELLOW patient, use a YELLOW potion. Use RED potions on RED patients, etc.

To make a potion, first click the GREY BOX to get a FLASK. Fill the flask with potion by clicking a YELLOW, CYAN, or MAGENTA box.

For other colours, visit several boxes! For example, make RED potions with YELLOW + MAGENTA. Orange is YELLOW + YELLOW + MAGENTA, and so on.

Refer to the colour chart below for more. To darken, add black (CYAN + YELLOW + MAGENTA) to the mix. Inexact potions may still help - but completely different potions are harmful!

Once you have the right potion, click a patient (the egg-shaped things) to make them drink it.

Patients die when their SICKNESS BAR fills with red. The game ends when three of your patients die.

entries.title: Square City [jam only]
entries.description:
The goal is to destroy all circles with your squares.

Click on a square to split it into 9 smaller squares.
Drag a square to shoot it.

----

Works in *any modern browser*. Sound only works in Firefox4.

entries.title: The Invasion of The Blobs
